bullets.text: Bank of Japan signals possible December rate hike, jolting global bonds and yen after years of ultra-easy policy.
Fed leadership transition looms with a frontrunner emerging for chair, injecting uncertainty into 2026 policy path.
U.S. customs collecting tariffs upon delivery for online purchases, surprising consumers and dampening cross-border e-commerce demand.
U.K. agrees to higher drug prices to avoid U.S. pharma tariffs, underscoring American market leverage in trade disputes.
South Korea auto stocks rise after U.S. cuts tariffs to 15%, easing trade tensions and supporting exports.
Nvidia invests $2B in Synopsys, tightening integration of AI compute with chip-design tools and expanding software moat.
Apple names ex-Microsoft/Google veteran to succeed retiring AI chief, signaling intensified push to regain AI leadership.
Crypto under pressure: Bitcoin posts worst day since March as sell-off resumes; European police shut major crypto mixer.
Data center electricity demand projected to surge nearly 300% by 2035, amplifying grid constraints and energy investment needs.
Ukraine peace talks shift to Moscow in pivotal week, with outcome hinging on Putin’s willingness to negotiate.
Russian launch-site accident disrupts crewed and cargo schedules, leaving Russia’s space program and ISS support plans uncertain.
Severe floods across Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Vietnam kill over 1,200, exposing infrastructure and economic risks from extreme weather.
Vaccine makers’ shares fall after FDA official cites link between COVID-19 vaccines and rare myocarditis in young men.
Starbucks agrees $39 million NYC settlement over scheduling-law violations, signaling rising labor-compliance costs.
